String.string: {UserName} has been kicked from the guild.
{UserName} has set the area tax rate.
{UserName}'s distribution will be delivered by parcel post.
Your guild won Civil Unrest, and received {GuildMoney} guild funds.
Start a GvG battle against {GuildName} guild? The GvG battle will last {Duration}.

The Declaring and Opposing Guilds are not in the same Crusade League. No Fame can be wagered for this GvG Battle. Do you wish to continue? (GvG Battle will last for <FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>{Duration}</FONT>.)
The GvG battle was a draw.
Do you want to surrender? The GvG battle against [{Opponent}] will end and they will be declared the winner.
Changing guild state from {OldState} to {NewState}. {NewState} guilds cannot engage in GvG battles.
Changing guild state from {OldState} to {NewState}. You may engage in GvG battles while {NewState}.
Your guild earned {Battlechip} Fame from a victory!
Your guild lost {Battlechip} Fame from a loss.
Your guild lost {Battlechip} Fame from draw.
Your guild earned {Battlechip} Fame because {GuildName} declined.
Your guild lost {Battlechip} Fame from declining a GvG Battle.
Your guild lost {Battlechip} Fame from cancellation.
GvG battle against {GuildName} canceled due to a problem with the GvG system.
GvG battle against {GuildName} canceled due to lack of Fame.
GvG battle canceled because {GuildName} guild lacks Fame.
This Crusade season is over. Ongoing GvG battles are cancelled.
Are you willing to wager <FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>{Battlechip}</FONT> additional Fame and continue the GvG battle against {GuildName}?
You will lose {BattleChip} Fame by giving up. Are you sure you want to give up?
{UserName} is under attack! Teleport to their side?
You have {GuildWarCount} GvG battles to check. Click on Confirm button to open the GvG Battles window.

Wager Fame and initiate a GvG battle against another guild. You may wager no more than <FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>50%</FONT> Fame. You may not start a GvG battle without wagering Fame or if the opposing guild doesn't have enough Fame.

Wager additional Fame and continue the GvG battle. You can wager up to <FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>50%</FONT> of your first wager. If the opposing guild owns Fame less than <FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>150%</FONT> percent of your wager, you may only wager up to the amount they currently have.
Your guild initiated a GvG battle against {Opponent} guild.
{Opponent} guild initiated a GvG battle against your guild!
Your guild wagered additional Fame in the GvG battle against {Opponent} guild.
You will lose {BattleChip} Fame on giving up. Are you sure you want to give up?
Your guild will lose {Battlechip} Fame if you cancel. Are you sure you want to cancel?
Your guild will lose {Battlechip} Fame by declining. Are you sure you want to decline?

Guilds with <FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>30</FONT>–<FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>100</FONT> active player accounts with a level <FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>65</FONT> character receive <FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>60</FONT> Fame per account every Wednesday (if an account has level 65 characters in several guilds, the Fame is divided between them). Guilds with Fame may participate in GvG battles, either as the Declaring Guild, or the Opposing Guild. Fame is only wagered between guilds in the same Crusade league (Cutthroat or Challenger).

Select Initiate a GvG Battle below, then type the name of the guild you want to fight. (Alternately, click on an opposing player and select from the displayed options, or Declare GvG from the Guilds on Server UI). Only guild members with GvG Authority may initiate a GvG Battle and wager Fame. The target guild then receives notice of the GvG Battle, after which both guilds enter a 30-minute waiting period. Either guild may surrender starting 1 hour after battle has begun.

The first guild with <FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>200</FONT> kills in 20 hours wins. If neither has <FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>200</FONT> kills, the guild with more kills wins. If both guilds have equal kills, or the total number is <FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#FF0000'>30</FONT> kills or less, the GvG Battle ends in a draw.

Fame earned from Cutthroat League GvG Battles adds to a guild's GvG Battle ranking at the end of each Crusade season. However, only guilds participating in more than <FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>8</FONT> GvG Battles during that season (<FONT SIZE='18' COLOR='#80E71C'>4 weeks</FONT>) are eligible for ranking.
Do you want to apply this setting? Once set, it cannot be reset.
To use the skill, a guild master needs to right-click the icon.

You receive Valderon Tokens when you complete a guild quest. Your reward will scale according to the amount of Valderon Tokens. You cannot receive your reward during your first week of membership in a guild. <FONT COLOR='#80E71C'>Valerdon Tokens reset at midnight, every Sunday.</FONT>
You can accept quests when Valderon Token are reset after joining a guild. If a quest is not completed on time, it is considered to have failed.
Valderon Tokens must reset at least once after you join a guild, for you to receive guild quests.
Your guild needs more members for you to receive the quest.
Valderon Tokens must reset at least once after you join a guild, for you to receive Valderon Token rewards.
You exceeded the limit of weekly Valderon Tokens. Cannot receive guild quests.
Daily quota of guild quests is complete.
You exceeded the limit of weekly Valderon Tokens. Cannot receive guild quest.
The guild quest is in progress.
Another guild has taken the quest.
Guild EXP and guild funds are rewarded upon completing the quest.
Valderon Tokens must reset at least once after you join a guild, for you to complete guild quests.
Only guild master or authorized guild members can cancel guild quests.
Valderon Tokens must reset at least once after you join a guild, for you to cancel guild quests.
Canceling quests consumes daily quota. Progress is deleted.
{Name} surrendered to {GuildName1} for a cost of {GuildMoney} guild funds as compensation.
{Name} declared GvG battle on {GuildName1} for a cost of {GuildMoney} guild funds.
{Name} withdrew GvG battle declaration on {GuildName1} due to lack of guild funds.
After withdrawing the declaration, you won't be able to declare on the same guild again for 72 hours. Are you sure you want to withdraw?
Declaring mutual GvG on {GuildName} costs {GuildMoney} guild funds. Do you want to proceed?

Surrendering requires your guild to compensate a portion of guild funds spent on this GvG battle by <FONT COLOR='#80E71C'>{GuildName}</FONT>.
Guild funds needed for compensation: <FONT COLOR='#80E71C'>{GuildMoney}</FONT>
If you surrender, this guild will not be able to declare GvG battle against you for <FONT COLOR='#80E71C'>{ProtectionTime}</FONT> hours. Do you want to surrender?

If you surrender, you pay <FONT COLOR='#80E71C'>{GuildMoney}</FONT> to <FONT COLOR='#80E71C'>{GuildName}</FONT> and buy peace for <FONT COLOR='#80E71C'>{ProtectionTime}</FONT> hours.
Do you really want to surrender?
Been in battle for {Hour} hour(s) {Minute} minute(s).

Accumulated cost of this battle: {WarCost} guild funds
Declaration penalty: {MaintainCost} guild funds per hour
Declared at {StartTime}
Declared war while there was no remaining Weekly Declaration Count.
Mutual GvG declared while there was no remaining Weekly Declaration Count.

Declaration cost and war expense penalties will apply when you exceed the weekly GvG declaration limit.

These penalties will keep you from receiving compensation from the enemy guild when the GvG ends.

Weekly Declaration count is reset every {ResetDay} at {ResettingHour}.
You won’t be able to be compensated for war costs if you have Weekly Declaration penalties.
Invite {UserName} to join your guild.\nIf the user accepts the invitation to your guild, they will join the guild <FONT COLOR='#80E71C'>immediately.</FONT> Do you want to invite this user?
